basic_info.name: Maruti Suzuki Brezza
basic_info.description: Maruti Suzuki Brezza is a 5-seater SUV available at a starting price of Rs. 8.26 Lakh. The car is available in 15 variants, with 2 engine and 2 transmission option. Additionally, Brezza offers a Ground Clearance measurement of 198 mm and a Boot capacity of 328 liters. You can choose from 10 colors for the Brezza. The mileage of the Brezza varies from 20.2 - 25.5 KM/L depending on the model.

colors: Sizzling Red With Midnight Black Roof
Splendid Silver With Midnight Black Roof
Brave Khaki With Pearl Arctic White Roof

Introduction: The Brezza is a compact SUV that has helped Maruti clocked good sales numbers in this segment.
Despite being a compact SUV, it has a spacious cabin and modern features as well.
Maruti has made sure the Brezza is available in multiple variants for diversely suitable price points, yet no more having a diesel counterpart.
The top-spec variants offer notable features such as a sunroof, head-up display, 360-degree camera, and more.
Maruti Brezza – Exterior: The Brezza gets boxy proportions and yet has a tall and wide stance.
Up front is a wide grille finished in dark or chrome elements, with headlamps neatly integrated on either side.
While entry-level variants get halogens, the higher variants boast LED projector headlamps with LED DRLs.
Adding on, the carmaker has provided a black body cladding around the lower edges to protect it from minor scratches.
Plus, a chunky front and rear bumper along with squared wheel arches add to the ruggedness.
Now, the side profile shows a clean design with a strong shoulder line and 16-inch alloy wheels.
Available with optional dual-toned roof, the Brezza’s roof rails visually increase its height adding to the styling in turn.
At the back, the SUV has horizontally placed LED tail lamps that stretch towards the sides.
For further personalistions, the dual-tone combinations include a red exterior with black roof, or khaki shade with white roof.
Maruti Brezza – Interior: Step inside, and you’ll notice that the Brezza has a clean dashboard design with black as the main stay with black-and-brown theme in higher variants.
Front seats are comfortable for short and taller individuals alike, with height-adjustable driver seat and support.
Rear seats can accommodate three adults and a 60:40 split fold functionality adds extra flexibility.
Then, a nine-inch touchscreen caters to all infotainment needs including music, maps, and calls with Apple CarPlay and Android Auto support.
The latter is paired with a semi-digital cluster showing important info at a glance.
A multi-function steering wheel adjusts tilt and reaches in top models for perfect driving position.
Other notable features include a wireless charger, ambient lighting on the doors, central armrest with storage, and a heads-up display.
Maruti Brezza – Powertrain: The Brezza is powered by a 1.5‑litre, four‑cylinder petrol engine which produces 99.2bhp and 136.8Nm of torque.
The transmission choices include a five-speed manual and a six-speed AMT.
Maruti also offers a factory CNG version of the same 1.5‑litre engine which churns 86.63bhp and 121.5Nm of torque.
This CNG option is available with just the five-speed manual gearbox.

verdict: Maruti Suzuki Brezza brings significant updates, both in terms of design and technology, making it a more attractive choice for modern buyers. While it faces stiff competition and comes with a premium price tag, its robust performance, tech-packed interior, and enhanced features make it a strong contender in the compact SUV space. It is ideal for buyers seeking a reliable, stylish, and well-equipped urban SUV.
